page.title: 09TRADITIONAL INDUSTRIES
page.content:
In Kilsyth in 1795 there were quite a lot of industries such as weaving,quarrying,farming,and mining. Other people worked as masons, blacksmiths or coopers.
Nowadays people don't work at these jobs apart from farming. Few people work in their own area. There are only about three big companies in our area.Those three are Nuttalls,Tube Developments and George Beattie & Sons. Mines are not very common now.People don't work as weavers or spinners either. Now people work as lorry drivers, joiners, prison officers and so on.
Many people are unemployed, especially teenagers who have just left school.
